descriptions.overview: The jumbo size galvanized steel post mount mailbox is constructed from heavy-duty galvanized steel and has a durable ribbed body for extra strength. The mailbox is an extra-large capacity unit that can accept various mail types including magazines and small parcels and can hold large volume mail deliveries or day's worth of mail. The mailbox features a rust resistant powder coat finish for lasting durability and stylish curb appeal. A steel latch and aluminum mail indicator flag are included, steel latch and aluminum flag.
list: Engineered with rust-resistant galvanized steel for extended endurance
Black powder-coated finish provides resistance against outdoor elements
Ribbed body enforces extra strength and stability
Extra large size provides 3,175 cubic inches of space to receive letters, padded envelopes and multiple boxes simultaneously
Door latch and outgoing mail flag can be adjusted for a tighter grip
Mailbox is completely assembled and ready for use
Match with any Gibraltar mailbox post with the designation letter code D

reviews.text: One improvement....there should be a metal tab to push your thumb against when opening the box. The lid is very large and you have to pull on it very hard to get it to open. This puts added stress on the post and will eventually loosen up the dirt around the post. I will make one out of stainless steel to avoid this problem. It will also assist in closing of the box due to the fact you have to push equally as hard to close it. Some pop-rivets and silicone should keep it water proof. Would be nice if it was maybe one gauge thicker material, it is a large box.
reviews.author: BOHICA

reviews.title: "Sturdy Standby"
reviews.text: This mailbox is easy to install, spacious, and does a good job of keeping mail dry.  Even many packages fit in. There is a simple adjustment that can be made if the door starts to slip open.  The only drawback is that the door hinge area is not painted, and can rust over time, and then the door falls off. I may try painting it myself on my new one.
reviews.author: Pat

reviews.title: "Biggest mailbox ever!"
reviews.text: The metal is a bit thin and I worry about the door not latching after use but time will tell. We bought the Postmaster post that was suggested to go with it and it looks great. I have posted a review of the post as well. For size reference, here is a pic of just how big it is!
reviews.author: bbbbmom

reviews.title: "Servicable but cheaply made"
reviews.text: I recently had to replace my two year-old mail box because a car had clipped it. I bought a replacement from the same store I had bought the previous one. While it looked very much the same, I was struck by how the quality had deteriorated. The door fits poorly -- so poorly that the company had drilled an off-center hole at the hinge just to get it attached. The hinge had two holes, one originally stamped in the door and a second drilled off center to get the door to match the box. The lower seams in the box were sloped so that the box did not fit well on the post. The box is serviceable but is disappointing for the $30+ price.
reviews.author: Jim-L

reviews.title: "Accomodates large packages"
reviews.text: I love this mailbox. It's really nice that that the postman can leave a large package in this oversized mailbox, instead of leaving a notice to come by the Post Office and pick it up.I have lived in my house for 30 years, and replaced my mailbox twice, each time with the same kind. A quick division will tell you that each one has lasted 15 years. The two that failed both had the same problem -- the door would not say closed. After about 15 years, the door gets bent a little bit, and the "latch" that's supposed to hold it closed is pretty much worthless. They have changed some other small aspects of the design, including replacing some metal parts with plastic, but have never addressed this problem, so I predict that this third one will also last about 15 years. The do not offer parts. You must replace the whole mailbox.Still, a 15-year life is not that bad.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Regret purchasing this :("
reviews.text: We receive a lot of packages, so I purchased the largest residential mailbox I could find. The door began to bend at the lower ridge (not hinge, but the ridge approx two inches above it) within three months. The metal at the edges of the door has split, and it's just a matter of time before it breaks entirely. Between the box and the house numbers I purchased for the sides, I spent over $50 for a product that will not last two years. I'm looking at replacement door kits, but for a box this size, they start at $55. If I can't fix this door, I will have to replace the entire box--but I definitely won't purchase another one from this manufacturer.
reviews.author: AK

reviews.title: "Good mailbox"
reviews.text: This is the second one I have ordered and they both arrived damaged. I don't know if it's happening on your end or during the delivery process. Once I hammered and bent them back into place it's a good mailbox.
reviews.author: Fatmantank

reviews.title: "Biggest box"
reviews.text: The rivets pulled end on the inside make this box difficult to mount. That said, I cut reliefs in my mounting base with a 5/8" drill 1/4" deep to allow rivets to slide over base. The mail box is the largest I could find only one Lowes in my area carried it, Home Depo had a smaller box for about the same price but did not know if it would be in stock. The experience at Lowes was terriffic/great and supper convenient . We purchased serveral other items at the same time. I plan to use this Lowes as my first choice for future purchases. I have a mail box that will accept all those big bundles. I listed the product as durable instead of high quality because it has not stood the test of time. The construction feels and appears to high quality. But only time will tell that story.
reviews.author: Bobber

reviews.title: "Yep, it's a BIG mailbox"
reviews.text: I bought this mailbox because I was tired of getting my photos folded in half. I'm a semi-professional photographer, and I use a lab to print my large photos. Too many times to count, I have picked up the mail and found an envelope folded in half, creasing my photos.So, when I saw this at Lowes I said, "Hey, that's a BIG mailbox". It sure is. It's made from thin gauge sheet metal, so it's a little wobbly before it's attached to a piece of plywood. That's what I recommend; screw or nail a 1/2" piece of plywood to the base (there's a perfect spot for it), then attach it to your post. I love the size of this thing, no more folded envelopes. Drawback is that I can't reach the back of it from the car window, so I have to park to get the mail.I'm going to spray paint the interior with Rust-oleum in white to brighten it up, and to seal it from the rain. The factory finish on this mailbox seems thin, so I'm trying to head off the rust.I do wonder, since I live in the country, if the large size will make it a target for baseball bats!
reviews.author: GeneS

reviews.title: "Large black metal mailbox"
reviews.text: Mailbox is good except for the door . In about 3 years the door breaks off from the rivets that hold it.There has got to be a better way to hinge the door. The thin metal at the hinge part of the door just wears out.It's a hassle to replace the mailbox every three years because the door breaks off.
reviews.author: OldTom

reviews.title: "Poor Product, Find Something Else"
reviews.text: This box is made by The Solar Group and was purchased at Lowe's. It is advertised as an "All Steel" box. Indeed, the shell is of some poor quality of steel, but the fixtures are all plastic. Our company bought this box for the capcity as we recieve large envelopes on a regular basis. We have had this box for three (3) years and the plastic closure latch has broken off. The only location to purchase a replacement is on the Solar Group Website for $15. And it is plastic also. Note that the entire box is $26. Additionally, there is already a large rust spot (10"x4") on the top of the box on the inside. If we had drilled holes to mount a box number sign on top of the box, we could understand the presence of rust, but there are no holes. A similar box at our old office is in better condition than this one (1) and it is fifteen (15) years older. We make check the manufacturer of this older box to try to locate one (1) elsewhere. Lowes has no other options in this style and size. In any event, we will be shopping for another product as this one (1) is junk.
reviews.author: Engineer

reviews.title: "Shoddy manufacturing, flimsy materials"
reviews.text: Examined this mailbox at the customer service counter after delivery, which was done quickly and efficiently. The sheet metal was bent and the box wobbled. The door would not stay closed. I left it at the customer service counter. Good customer service; not so good mailbox.
reviews.author: Woodside

reviews.title: "Seems to be well made"
reviews.text: We like that the entire box is steel, including the door latch. We are having to replace all 4 of our boxes due to broken, plastic door latches. These seem to be well made and sturdy. Can't wait to get them mounted and in use.
reviews.author: Duffez

reviews.title: "Quality control must be lacking"
reviews.text: This is not an issue with Lowe's. I purchased this mailbox (it was the last one on the shelves) and it was in an undamaged package. Got it home, opened the box, and the mailbox was badly dented in the left rear corner including dents to the base. Since the box was totally undamaged, I can only assume the product was damaged when it was packaged at the factory. Additionally, when it was painted, you could tell it was painted after the door was attached, and there were spots behind the hinges that were not painted. Over all, I believe the quality is lacking.
reviews.author: magoo

reviews.title: "Jumbo Mailbox"
reviews.text: This box is well made and quite strong. It allows me to receive packages that used to be returned for pickup at the Post Office, It has a plastic red flag that does the job well. I recommend it with no hesitation.
reviews.author: megavettes

reviews.title: "HUGE capacity Mailbox!"
reviews.text: I just really love the XL capacity of this mailbox. Our mail carrier loves it also. No more having to drive into town to the P.O. to pickup a package that won't fit in our mailbox and also our mail carrier doesn't need to drive up to our house to deliver an oversized package. Win/Win for everyone! I would buy this XL mailbox again. Seeing the high quality of material and finish I expect it to last a lifetime. Highly recommend to buy to all!
reviews.author: Michael

reviews.title: "US Mail Box"
reviews.text: I was looking for a larger mail box as the postman sometimes had trouble getting all my mail in the box without bending some things. This box was somewhat of overkill because it did not look that large in the store. It is a monster when compared to the boxes next to it. Now my mail lays flat in the box. It may be overkill, but I sure am glad that I got it.
reviews.author: Clay

reviews.title: "Just bearly worth the money"
reviews.text: It a nice big mail box, but they quit building them out of a heaver gauge sheet metal, and putting the corrugationAcross the the top of box to stiffen it up. my last one from the same maker lasted over ten years, I don't think this one will last.
reviews.author: Louis

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: A real piece of junk. Cheaply made with very thin metal that easily bends and twists. Red mail flag is attached with plastic. We all know how long that will last. Don't buy it unless it's just for display only.
reviews.author: Thomas

reviews.text: This product fills my need for a larger mail box to hold small and medium size packages. My mail carrier lovesit also, she can now drop all of my mail deliveries at the curb rather than coming to my door for the largerpackages. It's a win win for everyone.Good sturdy construction should endure the huge temperature swifts that come with season changes in thehigh desert conditions of southern Utah.
reviews.author: psyclegramps

reviews.title: "Bigger Mailbox needed"
reviews.text: With many of us ordering on-line and having things shipped to us more often, it makes sense to install a mailbox that can handle larger packages. This keeps the mail person from having to pull up to the house or one of us driving to the post office to pick things up.
reviews.author: Troy

reviews.title: "Strength"
reviews.text: I selected this specific mailbox due to my retirement to rural America. The local post office building is located in the near larger city to my community. Wanted larger package to be place in mailbox to prevent from driving  to the city to pick up packages. This product is constructed from a low grade steel and due to the size the box is flimsy and shies when opening and closing access door.  I constructed my stand and pole with heavy grade steel. When wielding the stand I provide access to use all screws and bolts, however,!the mailbox remains flimsy when opening and closing door.
reviews.author: Carey

reviews.title: "very sturdy"
reviews.text: We had to replace our mailbox after a tree limb fell on it. The one that we replaced is just like this and it has served us well for many years. We do a lot of ordering online and this mailbox is a great size for packages.
reviews.author: NCHiker

reviews.title: "Good item"
reviews.text: I would recommend the mailbox if you receive and send a lot of mail. It's roomy, sturdy, and the price is right. I ordered this on line, it was delivered quickly and the shipping fees were reasonable.
reviews.author: Patc

reviews.title: "Open and check items before taking home!"
reviews.text: Usually 40% of stock in store damaged in shipment to the location. This is an improvement of what it was 14 months ago. Purchased many of these for our developments required mailboxes. Only mailbox like this one anywhere so we have to live with it. :-(
reviews.author: JimJim

reviews.title: "Do your Postal Carrier a favor"
reviews.text: Be kind to your postal carrier and buy a big mail box. The smaller standard boxes don't fit packages and force your carried to come to the front door. Try doing that 600 times a day! For a few dollars more you can get this big box which will hold all but the biggest boxes and bags and keep them out of the weather.The boxes get a lot of use and do get metal fatigue, but I'm talking years of use.
reviews.author: Dutch

reviews.title: "Not the size it says"
reviews.text: I Purchase this mail box on it was the size it said on the box i get a box in the mail that are 11 in wide and 19 in long and bout 2 in high with medical supplies i should had checked before i installing the box didn't have much time before darkthe box says 15 in h 11.7 w and 24.8 in deep the size is 13.5 h 10.75 w and 19 deep it's thin if any thing much hits it are even if you have a any hail in a storm i don't think it would hold up I also spent a lot to make the mount look good and not junkieThe box itself looks and the lumber used to mount it looks real good i would had gave it a 5 star if it was the size it said i am very disappointed been out a lot of money and didn't get what i paid for
reviews.author: Frank

reviews.title: "mailbox"
reviews.text: Love the metal handle. Unlike so many others with the plastic handle this should last for years.
reviews.author: esnagi

reviews.title: "Gibraltar mailbox"
reviews.text: Had my last one for 28 years.
reviews.author: Skip

reviews.title: "Hasn't been bashed since you can't see it at nigh"
reviews.text: You could give me more room to write:The black is perfect. You can't see it at night. So far, no one has come through to bash it.
reviews.author: Country-girl

reviews.title: "all mail mailbox"
reviews.text: needed a mailbox for all small packages ,books ,magazines,and mail ,all at once this is ideal.
reviews.author: robert

reviews.title: "Poor quality"
reviews.text: The mailbox is so thin and flimsy that the door will not shut because the mailbox will not hardly hold its shape. Anytime the door is open, the mailbox is not sturdy from side to side. If you need a "large" mailbox, spend the few extra bucks and get one that is more durable than this one
reviews.author: Dusty

reviews.title: "Bad purchase"
reviews.text: The door either will not close or sticks. Numerals for my house address will not adhere to the sides. This is a larger box and the only one carried by Lowes. The material is the only positive.
reviews.author: Grandma

reviews.title: "Wow! What a nice big mailbox"
reviews.text: Very happy with our new mailbox...
reviews.author: Clarabell

reviews.title: "Mailman Loves It"
reviews.text: This was a replacement after someone ran over the original. Mailman stopped just as I was putting the finishing touches on it and said he loves these bigger boxes as he can put decent size packages in them.
reviews.author: SaintJohn

reviews.title: "EXTRA LARGE USPS APPROVED MAILBOX"
reviews.text: I recently decided to purchase an XL Mailbox because the previous standard size mailbox was actually, too small for the size packages we have been receiving.Our Letter Carrier was kind enough to leave our packages inside our screened in lanai, in the front of our home.  But she would leave any 1st Class and Periodical Mail in our mailbox, at the curb.Now, other than a box or package that is simply way too big to fit in our XL Mailbox, I don't foresee our mail being in two locations frequently.  We are very pleased with the results so far!
reviews.author: TJ

reviews.title: "Large and roomy."
reviews.text: Better design than the one we had before. The pull at the top is welded on instead of being a plastic attachment.
reviews.author: Swatkins

reviews.title: "Largest all steel mail box around!"
reviews.text: Bought two of these. One for mail and one for packages. Installed easily and the mailman is very happy with them.
reviews.author: ljmadsen

reviews.title: "great durable mail box"
reviews.text: great mail box.heavy duty. able to hold almost all parcels shipped thru mail.very easy to install
reviews.author: catdog

reviews.title: "Works like a mailbox!"
reviews.text: I recently moved into the city and wanted a larger than normal box to hide any small Amazon packages from predators. This box holds quite a bit and its the same price as most other boxes in the store (a bit less than $40). It feels the same thickness as other metal boxes doesn't look like it will rust. I live in WA. I can't give it 5 stars because occasionally I see the door open. I don't know if it's a latching issue or if the letter carrier isn't closing the door all the way.
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "A little weak."
reviews.text: If you need a box you can receive packages in, at the best price I could find, then this is what you're looking for, with one exception. The metal of this box is a bit on the thin side, which in turn means that the body will bend during installation, making the lid difficult to close. I suppose it could be reinforced, but as I said, for the price this is the best you will find.
reviews.author: J-Lai

reviews.text: I searched all through the box it came in and could not find the mounting plate that allows it to be post mounted.
reviews.author: Jim-K

reviews.title: "Great big box for rural routes"
reviews.text: We wanted a mailbox to fit our large amazon envelopes and small boxes and this works great!
reviews.author: Sam

reviews.title: "It's big!"
reviews.text: I changed to this large box from our standard size and it seems to be about 3 times larger and will fit much larger packages. It doesn't seem to be of great quality but it will do.  I built the post and platform myself so I know that is very sturdy.  And I can repair the box should the (hinge) rivets wear over time.  I'm sure the mailperson is happier they do not need to drive up the driveway as much to deliver packages that were too big for the smaller box.
reviews.author: JpB

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: KARL

reviews.title: "Good big mailbox"
reviews.text: I PUT A TREATED PIECE OF WOOD UNDER BOX AND SCREWED IT ON AND SCREWED IT TO THE WOODEN POST I MADE OUT OF 4X4S AND BURIED IT AND PUT MY NAME AND ADDRESS ON IT.
reviews.author: TOM TERRIFIC

reviews.title: "No Post"
reviews.text: The description of this item states "with post", however, upon receipt, I noticed it was not included. I called the store to verify, and the store clerk confirmed that a post is not included. I recommend removing that from the description.
reviews.author: barnett

reviews.title: "Mailbox review"
reviews.text: I have purchased many of these mailboxes for our development. Good job going away from the plastic hardware. Some of the ones I have purchased have a cardboard tube under the finger pull during shipping, which is good because the ones that don't usually have the finger pull mashed nearly flat.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "BIG BOX"
reviews.text: Living in the country often means packages from UPS & FedEx are left at our local post office for delivery. This requires a 5 mile round trip to pick up packages that don't fit in our rural route box. But since buying this bigger box all packages fit so no more unnecessary trips to the PO!!
reviews.author: Jamila

reviews.title: "Good Value for Price"
reviews.text: I needed a large mailbox but didn't want to spend a lot. This box was an obvious choice. At $35.00 it's a good value. My only complaint would be that the metal is rather thin but at this price point it's acceptable. If I needed another, I would buy this again.
reviews.author: Chas

reviews.title: "mail box, large cap."
reviews.text: trouble with latch you could get it working one day and the next with a temp. change it wouldn't stay closed or it would not close properly.  All it needed was more thought into the latch, the old one I had for years was plastic and lasted for years.
reviews.author: bob

reviews.title: "Great size, no hardware"
reviews.text: I love the traditional look of this mailbox and the large size is great also.  My only problem is that is did not come with any hardware. Not a deal breaker, but if I had known I would have gotten the correct hardware at the store before I left.
reviews.author: Jack

reviews.title: "mailbox . . ."
reviews.text: . . . replaced a 25+ year old one that I wasn't able to fix. This one was abourt the same size and was a little less ornate. I was able with a little easy work to fit the new mailbox to the old stand, where I hope it'll work for another 25 0r so years.
reviews.author: Robins

reviews.title: "Basic Classic Design"
reviews.text: I needed an extra large Mailbox to replace the one that was destroyed by a careless driver. This is the standard mailbox design and has the same features that the same style had back in the fifties. If you are looking for a good classic mailbox, this will be the one you need.
reviews.author: Randy

reviews.title: "Won't stay closed."
reviews.text: I'm going to have to install a magnetic closer on this thing because, brand new, it won't stay closed. I love having to dry off what portion of my mail doesn't just blow-away.
reviews.author: HenionJD

reviews.title: "Great size"
reviews.text: I've bought a similar mailbox in the past, the snow plows destroyed it.  I love this size mailbox, packages easily fit so they are not left out in the rain.  Easy to install.
reviews.author: Candace

reviews.title: "PostMaster Metal Black Post Mount Mailbox"
reviews.text: We are very happy with this mailbox.  It is very roomy which will allow our mail delivery person to leave small packages without the need to bring the packages to the door.
reviews.author: Debbie

reviews.text: For its size is made of light gauge metal. There was a dent in the top of the mailbox which I was able to press out with my hand. For the price not a bad value.
reviews.author: PA12

reviews.title: "Good functional mailbox"
reviews.text: this mailbox is good, functions well, reasonably pricedPrior purchase (earlier this year) of same model was not satisfactory (door did not stay closed)
reviews.author: mogard

reviews.title: "Perfect box"
reviews.text: This mailbox is perfect for what I need.  I get packages daily, so I needed a large box.  This box was easy to install and perfect for the job.
reviews.author: McMillan

reviews.title: "Big ol' mailbox"
reviews.text: I bought this to replace a very similar one that had gotten hit a couple times by the mailman.  There is nothing particularly outstanding about this mailbox.  It is just a good, functional, no nonsense mailbox.  Check it before you bring it home.  It seems the people like to treat it like a football as it moves through inventory.  The first one I got was dented.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.text: easy assembly, fast shipping. Great product for the price. Leary about the plastic door pull/latch at first, but very sturdy/durable.
reviews.author: guettlerjk

reviews.title: "Perfect Rural Mailbox"
reviews.text: The snowplow took out our mailbox (again!). Purchased this replacement mailbox. This is a quality item, well made and looks great.
reviews.author: CFlips

reviews.title: "Great mail box for the price"
reviews.text: This is a nice mail box for the price (just a everyday price wasn't on sale) bet everyone in town for a comparable mail box.
reviews.author: mt1950

reviews.title: "Don't Count On Your Mail Getting Picked Up!"
reviews.text: The box itself is OK, but the flag design is really poor.  It is constantly getting put down by light breezes and I find my outgoing mail has not been picked up.  Also, because it is deep, the mail carrier likes to throw it to the back of the box, so I can no longer get my mail without getting out of my car.  Look for a different solution if you can.
reviews.author: Pourshot

reviews.title: "Good replacement for and old mail box"
reviews.text: Bought this mailbox to replace a similar mailbox that the door fell off of. Perfect replacement.
reviews.author: Killowatt

reviews.title: "Potential for excellent product."
reviews.text: Given 5 stars upfront. Maybe less stars in the future. I like the mailbox at this present time.
reviews.author: Elder

reviews.title: "Great size"
reviews.text: I got to so all the mail and small packages fit in it. Exactly what I wanted and good quality.
reviews.author: Ty

reviews.title: "Large mailbox"
reviews.text: We needed a large mailbox for packages that we get. This box works great and at a great price.
reviews.author: UPSDAD

reviews.title: "Big Mailbox"
reviews.text: This is a big mailbox but like everything these days it is not a sturdy made as my old one.
reviews.author: Angela

reviews.title: "Excellent, works fine"
reviews.text: I would prefer a more heavy duty box. Buy it seems to be an excellent buy.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "FOR WORK"
reviews.text: THIS IS THE PERFECT SIZE MAILBOX FOR WORK...IT FITS PACKAGES!!!
reviews.author: Codie

reviews.title: "Great mailbox"
reviews.text:
Solid, well built mailbox. 
Fit perfectly on my post.
reviews.author: GeorgeL

reviews.title: "This mailbox is huge"
reviews.text: Nice mailbox.  Mounts perfectly on the Gibraltar plastic base (had to buy that elsewhere [@HD]).  The box is very large and useful for packages.  Perhaps the metal is a bit thin for its size; time will tell.  Ours came with a few unpainted spots; a covering of Rustoleum semi gloss black spray paint fixed that.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Searching for a replacement."
reviews.text: I purchase an average 50-60 per month. damage return % is decreasing however had 16% return rate in last order of 25. Exchange is easy because of Lowe's excellent customer service however time spent traveling to/from the store is a time waster.
reviews.author: mailbox man

reviews.title: "Nice box"
reviews.text: I went to buy it. because how much does one need in a mail box. it is a standard well built box. I got distracted in the aisle by magnetic closures and brass and bronze colored boxes. This one would have been just fine but I found a bronze one and I had to have it!!
reviews.author: Anji

reviews.title: "Great size!"
reviews.text: We ha s this mailbox at our old home and just recently bought another for our new home. It's a good size for a bulk of the packages we receive. So instead of leaving every package outside our front door in the weather elements, they can be protected in the mailbox.
reviews.author: Kbuonanno

reviews.title: "11.125-in x 15-in Metal Black Post Mount Mailbox"
reviews.text: Latch to keep door closed is Broken / did not notice until I put house numbers and nameon it and a yellow flag that pops up when the postman opens it / and got it ready to mount.. would advise anyone to open it and make sure to latch is there.
reviews.author: Louise

reviews.title: "Worked like a champ"
reviews.text: Easy to install. Works as advertised. Plenty of room for packages. Now, if I can make it last more than 7 years due to people running it over. Does not come with screws nor special mounting equipment. Really do like this mailbox though.
reviews.author: CRuff

reviews.title: "OK but metal is thinner."
reviews.text: My previous mailbox (about 20 years old) had significantly thicker metal.  This mailbox can be easily deformed so that the door won't latch shut.  But I expect to get good use out of it, I just have to be careful with it.
reviews.author: Louis

reviews.title: "Bigger is better with this bad boy mailbox!"
reviews.text: I needed a larger mailbox, and this filled the bill nicely. Nothing fancy, but it does what it's supposed to: holds plenty of mail and larger packages and should do the job for years to come. The price is right, also.
reviews.author: Veganman

reviews.title: "Good Value"
reviews.text: This mailbox is a good quality mailbox for the price.  It's a nice lager size so large envelopes  and small boxes will fit.  This is my second purchase of this mailbox.  My first one lasted about 15 years.
reviews.author: Annie

reviews.title: "GREAT MAILBOX"
reviews.text: THIS IS A GREAT MAILBOX ALTHOUGH IT DOESN'T HOLD UP TOO WELL WHEN OUR SCHOOL BUS DRIVER BACKS OVER IT WHILE TURNING AROUND IN OUR DRIVEWAY. (I HATE SCHOOL BUSES)
reviews.author: PETE

reviews.title: "Mailbox review"
reviews.text: The mailbox is sturdy, and big! We are located semi-rurally, so if we have packages, most will fit in the mailbox, and we don't have to trek to the post office.
reviews.author: Debbi

reviews.title: "Mailbox"
reviews.text: Perfect size, bright color, sturdy.  Only the second one I have had to buy in 20 years.  Easily meets the requirements for my homeowner's association mailbox.
reviews.author: handywoman

reviews.title: "Large Metal Black Mailbox"
reviews.text: I purchased this mailbox because I wanted a large one to hold packages and other large items. It seems to be a good product for the purchase price.
reviews.author: froggy

reviews.title: "Mailbox easy install"
reviews.text: Box is large, easy to install. Be sure to measure the bottom cutout and obtain 3/4 inch plywood for that and some good stainless screws.
reviews.author: homerhandyman

reviews.title: "Reasonable mailbox"
reviews.text: Good size, but made of thin metal.  While it will work, it needs to be made from thicker metal to increase it strength and durability.
reviews.author: Selfhelp

reviews.title: "THE CHERRYIEST MAILBOX I'LL EVER OWN"
reviews.text: THE BIGGEST MAILBOX I'LL EVER SEE& OWN THAT'S APPROVED BY THE POST MASTER GENERAL & IT'S EXTREMELY WICKED SICK SWEET 2 THE NTH DEGREE

reviews.title: "THE CHERRYIEST MAILBOX I'LL EVER OWN"

reviews.title: "Mailbox"
reviews.text: If you get a lot mail this is the box. However, had to adjust ( bend the door a litte) to make it stay closed a little better.
reviews.author: Brandon

reviews.title: "My mistake for buying the wrong size"
reviews.text: This is HUGE! I didn't pay attention to the dimensions and had to return it. There was nothing wrong with the mailbox though.
reviews.author: Bri

reviews.title: "Sturdy Mailbox"
reviews.text: Needed to replace an old rusty mailbox. This one was perfect, its sturdy and large enough to hold most standard USPS boxes.
reviews.author: Geoff

reviews.title: "Serves its purpose."
reviews.text: Easily installable, holds larger than normal packages and envelopes. Lightweight and should be durable.
reviews.author: Sonny

reviews.title: "Mail Box"
reviews.text: Needed the box like yesterday snow plow destroyed like 20 boxes!!! Lowe's had a box like I wanted.
reviews.author: Brad

reviews.title: "Cheap made"
reviews.text: Every time I buy a new mailbox they find a way to make them thinner be careful when installing it.
reviews.author: Keebler

reviews.title: "Extra Large Mailbox ..."
reviews.text: This will be the 3rd one I've bought in 30 years ... Just The Best Big Mailbox I've Ever Seen ...
reviews.author: Harry

reviews.title: "Great Big Mailbox"
reviews.text: Got this for my dad to accommodate larger prime deliveries.  It installed easily and works great.
reviews.author: Doug

reviews.title: "Great Box"
reviews.text: Nice big,sturdy box. Easy to install and much cheaper than all of the similar boxes.
reviews.author: Joel

reviews.title: "Hard to find x-large mailboxes"
reviews.text: I checked around before buying a new mailbox. Lowes had it at the best price.
reviews.author: lhuffman615

reviews.title: "Mail b"
reviews.text: I gave only 3 stars because how flimsy it feels. Very thin aluminum.
reviews.author: Alex

reviews.title: "EXTRA-LARGE MAILBOX"
reviews.text: GREAT SIZE!...HOLDS A LARGE AMOUNT OF MAIL & A GREAT PRICE!!!

reviews.text: Love my mailbox big easy to put up and looks great

reviews.author: Jules

reviews.title: "Good sturdy mailbox"
reviews.text: I have had this mailbox for approximately 10 years. The door rivets have broken off but not due to wear and tear. The mailman got too close with her vehicle and knocked my mailbox off the post. TWICE! My mailbox has been hit when kids on their golf carts lose control of the vehicle. The kids have knocked my mailbox and broken the post holding it numerous times. I have had to replace the wooden post 7 times in the past 10 years but my mailbox keeps surviving. My husband has even backed his vehicle into it when there was a heavy fog morning and he couldn't see it. LOL! I have accidently pulled the door completely off when it got covered with ice last Winter and froze the door shut. I fixed the door by screwing a 3 inch screw into the hole where the rivet had been broken off. I used a wooden mounting base on the mailbox so the screw worked great. I now have to replace the mailbox because vandals and thugs who moved in the neighborhood have shot my mailbox to pieces so the door will no longer close. I am replacing the mailbox with one like it again. Other than getting shot up, my mailbox held together through all the hits and knockdowns it has received over the past 10 years. Mailman still folds up my mail (like magazines) so it will fit into the mail tray she uses in her vehicle.  This mailbox is huge! Now she can fit all the junk mail, bills, magazines and medium size boxes into my mailbox without problems. I will recycle it into a garden storage box to store my many hand garden tools. I love this mailbox! It has proven to be a sturdy one!
reviews.author: BeckyBW

questions.question: "What do I mount this large mailbox with?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Loring
answers.text: I have found the best method is to cut a board that is the size of the bottom of the mailbox, mount it to the post with screws and then screw the mailbox to this base with screws.

answers.author: Killowatt
answers.text: I replace my old mailbox by removing it from a home made mounting platform and mounting the new mailbox back just like the old on was mounted.

answers.author: GeneS
answers.text: Hmm...mounting bracket? This mailbox is intended to mount to a plywood (or similar) base that is attached to a post. When I mounted mine, I screwed the plywood (cut to fit inside the base of the mailbox) to the arm of my post, then screwed the mailbox to the plywood using the holes drilled in the side of the mailbox.

answers.author: J-Lai
answers.text: The box says "Made in the U.S.A.", as does the Spanish translation under that sentence.

answers.author: J-Lai
answers.text: Postmaster by Stranton (no location given other than made in the U.S.A.

answers.author: Stretch
answers.text: Latch is metal flag is plastic

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: The latch is steel and the flag is aluminum.

questions.question: "IS THE MANUFACTURE NAME SCRIBED OR PRINTED ANYWHERE ON THE MAILBOX?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. The name should be on back of the mailbox Solar Group Taylorsville , MS. 39168.

questions.question: "I need to know if this mailbox meets weight requirements of 10 pounds or under,"
questions.author: Beverly

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. The weight is 11.5 lbs.

questions.question: "Is it possible to mount this mailbox onto a concrete piller? If so, how?"
questions.author: Bautz

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. Yes, this mailbox has mounting holes on the side and bottom for several different mounting applications including concrete pillars. The specific application and hardware needed would depend on your particular application.

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our products. This mailbox weighs 11.5 lbs. We hope you found this information helpful!

questions.question: "I have a wood post. Can this be mounted on a wood post?"
questions.author: Germaine

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your recent inquiry. Yes, the Metal Black Post Mount Mailbox can be mounted on a Wood Post. We hope you find this information helpful.

answers.author: Gibraltar Mailboxes
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in our product. The post and hardware are sold separately, however we recommend matching this mailbox with Gibraltar post model LBP000B01 or LVP000B01.
